In the Dobropillya direction, both Russian and Ukrainian forces have advanced over the last 10 days, with Ukrainian forces making significant progress in a series of coordinated counterattacks.
North of Pokrovsk, Ukrainian forces launched a mechanised assault towards the northwestern outskirts of Pokrovsk. They managed to recapture the two pig farm complexes and a series of treeline positions, however the attack on the outskirts of the city, which involved Abrams tanks from the 425th Separate Assault Regiment "Skala", was ultimately repelled.
In Rodynske, Ukrainian forces have resumed their assault operations in the city. They advanced east from their strongpoints and entered the southeastern streets, outflanking Russian positions in the city centre. They cleared part of the low-rise residential area there and entrenched in the western part of the southeastern high-rise micro-district, which the Russians are now bombing with FAB glide-bombs. They also entrenched in a number of 3-story-buildings in western Rodynske.
Northeast of Rodynske, Ukrainian forces have made significant progress over the last 10 days. They recaptured the southern part of Suhketske and broke through to the Krasnolymanskaya Mine, establishing full control over this crucial stronghold. Building on their momentum, they advanced further east to one of the ventilation shafts for the mine, capturing it and the surrounding areas. Russian forces subsequently carried out a massive, mechanised assault consisting of around 40 heavy and light vehicles of various types on the ventilation shaft, which was repelled with heavy losses. 
In Myrnohrad, Russian forces continued finalising their clearing operations in the central and northern parts of the city. They managed to complete the capture of the city centre and secured the rest of the residential areas to the west. They also continued clearing the northern streets, consolidating in the low-rise residential streets south and southeast of the cemetery.
+ ~10.84 km¬≤ in favour of Ukraine.
+ ~0.79 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

Russian forces have captured the village of Novomarkove, Rai-Oleksandrivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~63.
Total land area: ~0.65 km¬≤.
The fighting for Novomarkove lasted <10 days.

Russian forces have recaptured the village of Varachyne, Khotin direction, Sumy Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~62.
Total land area: ~0.37 km¬≤.
The fighting for Varachyne lasted approximately 75 days.

A Russian soldier is seen draping the flag of the 57th Brigade over the statue of Nestor Makhno in the city centre of Hulyaipole. 
Coordinates: 47.666078, 36.2529328

David is so annoyed at me for reporting about the reality in Ukraine that he is now openly lying about me, beyond just speculative opinions. The only time I ever spoke to him through a call was in a public space prior to him blocking and condemning me. I have never had a private call with him, and the fact that he is lying to himself and others shows how desperate he is. 
It seems like every couple of weeks he has another little meltdown, calling me Pro-Russian and the closest friend of @.squatsons. But what's funny is that he can't even get his info about me correct.
David is an American boomer, indoctrinated since birth, who is now spouting his nonsense online to an ever-shrinking audience of comfort-media-consumers. He's someone that you should never take seriously, unless you like being lied to.
But don't worry, his grift will be over soon. Any form of reputation he still has will be lost once this war is over, as people realise that he has lied about everything. I have a whole catalogue of stupid things he's posted that have aged terribly and contradicted earlier statements he's made. Perhaps I should post them at some point?

Using an old photo from when I was 15 to try and discredit my work isn't a good look, Deepstate!
Although I'm sure the SBU would be very proud of your keyboard warrior activity.
You want AMK to go back to school? then stop telling lies.
You want AMK to go back to school? then stop telling lies.
I'm aware of the missile attack. I was busy earlier, but I'm working on a map now. There may be more missiles later on.

3 Tu-95MS carried out launch maneuvers around 10 minutes ago, likely from southern Nizhny Novgorod Oblast.
If the launches were real and not simulated, missiles should enter Ukrainian airspace in the next 2 hours. 
Kyiv was under attack from missiles earlier, meaning any Kh-101s will likely fly to attack the city too.

Currently airborne:
2 Tu-160s from Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast.
4 Tu-95MS from Belaya Airbase, Irkutsk Oblast.
3 Tu-95MS from Olenya Airbase, Murmansk Oblast.

Update:
5 Tu-95MS are confirmed airborne from Belaya Airbase.
This means that there are 10 strategic bombers in total in the air. 
However, the initial launch maneuvers carried out by 3 Tu-95MS were probably simulated with electronic warfare.

Launch maneuvers were carried out by 2 Tu-160s and 5 Tu-95MS from Kalachyovksy District, Volgograd Oblast, around 10 minutes ago.
These launches were likely real, meaning that Kh-101 cruise missiles are expected to enter Ukrainian airspace in the next 80 minutes.

Here's the current missile map. Sorry for the wait, I took a while confirming some of the info.
So far, the CHP-4, CHP-5, and CHP-6 power plants in Kyiv, along with Ozerne Airbase in Zhytomyr Oblast have been struck by Kinzhal, Iskander-K and Iskander-M missiles.

Before all the hype gets out of hand, the rest of this missile attack will be nothing special.
Likely around 20-30 Kh-101 cruise missiles will target Ukraine, mainly flying to energy infrastructure in Kyiv (e.g. Trypillya, CHP-4, CHP-5, CHP-6, 750 kV, Bila Tserkva CHP, etc). Other targets may be hit in other regions. 
Just because there are 10 strategic bombers airborne, it doesn't mean there will be 100 missiles or whatever.

If the launches took place when I think they did, we should see missiles enter Ukrainian airspace via Sumy Oblast in the next 20-25 minutes.
They will probably fly in groups of 3-4 missiles, with each 1-2 groups flying one after another.

Oh damn, I just realised I passed Scott in subscribers. 
I'll never forget how he first promoted my channel and helped get me my first 100 subs in mid-2024. His help has done so much for me and my channel.

If the launches took place when I think they did, we should see missiles enter Ukrainian airspace via Sumy Oblast in the next 20-25 minutes.  They will probably fly in groups of 3-4 missiles, with each 1-2 groups flying one after another.
No missiles are detected yet. They should arrive in the next 10 minutes.

Large amounts of Geran-2 drones are flying to Kyiv from multiple different directions. 
This is the second wave of drone attacks on the city.
No missiles are detected yet. They should arrive in the next 10 minutes.

There's still no sign of Kh-101 cruise missiles in Ukrainian airspace.
I still think some were launched, so it's possible that the initial launch maneuvers were simulated and repeated, undetected launches have been carried out since then.

North Korea‚Äôs Kim Orders Expansion Of Missile Production During Visit To Key Facilities (Photos)
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un ordered an expansion of the country‚Äôs missile and shell production capacity to meet the military‚Äôs growing need for the weapons during inspections of major munitions industry enterprises, state-run media reported on December 26.
The Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) reported that Kim, accompanied by senior officials, visited key munitions enterprises.
Officials briefed Kim on the achievements of the missile and shell production sector in 2025, including output in the fourth quarter, according to the news agency, which did not give details on the locations of the factories or reveal when the visit took palace.
‚ÄúIt is necessary to reinforce the technical foundations of the relevant production enterprises in a balanced way to further expand the overall production capacity,‚Äù KCNA quoted Kim as saying.
üëâ

Russia Begins Delivering Heavy Drones To The Front Lines Amid Strikes On Ukrainian Logistics
During the exchange of strikes on the night of December 26, Russian forces used, according to the Ukrainian Air Force, one Iskander-M ballistic missile and 99 attack drones, 73 of which were shot down/suppressed. 
Russia aims to paralyze the strategically important railway line from Ukraine to Poland (the Kyiv-Kovel line). This was stated by¬†Ukrainian military radio technology specialist Serhii Beskrestnov, known by the call sign "Flash." He notes that attacks on this artery are following one after another: two days ago, the strike hit a train; the day before yesterday, a railway bridge; and last night, a locomotive depot. He predicts further strikes on objects of this line and calls for their protection.
Simultaneously, the Russian side announced the delivery to the front line of the first test batch of the newest heavy combat drones "Berdysh," numbering about 100 units.
üëâ

HERE

Ukraine Has Lost Nearly All of Huliaipole (Videos)
On December 26, the Russian military extended its control over most of the center and northern part of Huliaipole in Zaporozhye, and advanced in its eastern part, reducing the area under Ukrainian control to less than 20 percent of the city.
Videos posted online confirmed that Russian troops from the Vostok [East] Group of Forces have reached the Nestor Makhno statues at the heart of Huliaipole ‚Äì also known as Gulyaypole -, as well as the ‚ÄúI Love Huliaipole‚Äù sign in the northern part of the city.
Just a day earlier, the troops broke through Ukrainian defenses in Sobornaya Street in the city center and captured the headquarters of Ukraine‚Äôs 102nd Territorial Defense Brigade. Kiev forces withdrew in a rush leaving behind everything, including their communication equipment, which explains their later collapse in the nearby areas.
üëâ

Elite Russian Drone Unit Eliminates Ukrainian Tank Gathering Near Kostiantynivka (Videos)
The Center for Advanced Unmanned Technologies ‚ÄúRubicon‚Äù announced on December 26 that it has destroyed more than two dozen Ukrainian armored vehicles which were gathered in the Kostiantynivka direction in Donetsk in a well-planned special operation.
The gathering was near the city of Druzhkivka, a logistics and command hub of Kiev forces located right to the north of the city of Kostiantynivka where the Russian military‚Äôs Yug [South] Group of Forces is currently advancing.
Rubicon said that the gathering was discovered by one of its drone pilots on December 20, and was quickly targeted in an attack that went on for hours.

Key Heights And Forests: Russian Army Makes Tactical Moves Against Ukrainian Forces In Slaviansk
In the Kharkiv sector, Russian units are achieving tactical success by advancing south of Vilcha towards Hrafskyi and capturing strongpoints in forested areas. In the Slaviansk sector, after establishing control over Sviato-Pokrovske, assault groups have reached the eastern part of Reznykivka. They are conducting fierce fighting in Zakotne and the Bondarne area. In the Zaporizhzhia sector, Kosivtsiv was taken under control. 
In Huliaipole, units established control over a significant part of the city, including a captured headquarters. In the Sumy sector, advances of up to 600 meters have been noted in several areas, including Andriivka. Meanwhile, the Ukrainian command is attempting to reinforce defenses and prevent troop withdrawals. 
Kyiv's European allies plan to finalize a package of security guarantees for Ukraine in January 2026.
Read more 
HERE
